parameters.name: Resource
parameters.description: The type of Azure resource to get best practices for. Options include: 'general' (general Azure best practices), 'azurefunctions' (Azure Functions specific best practices), or 'static-web-app' (Azure Static Web Apps specific best practices).

parameters.name: Action
parameters.description: The action to perform. Options include: 'all' (best practices for both code generation and deployment, only for static-web-app), 'code-generation' (best practices for code generation, for general and azurefunctions), or 'deployment' (best practices for deployment, for general and azurefunctions).

parameters.name: Message array
parameters.description: Array of messages in the conversation (JSON format). Each message should have role and content properties.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

operations.title: Knowledge: Get index schema

Get the detailed schema configuration of a specific knowledge index from Azure AI Foundry.

This operation shows you comprehensive information about the structure and configuration of a knowledge index, including field definitions, data types, searchable attributes, and other schema properties. Use this schema information to understand how the index structures and indexes your data for searching.

operations.title: OpenAI: Create chat completions
operations.description: Create chat completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send messages to Azure OpenAI chat models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive AI-generated conversational responses. Supports multi-turn conversations with message history, system instructions, and response customization.

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: Deployment
parameters.description: The name of the Azure AI Foundry model deployment.

parameters.name: Message array
parameters.description: Array of messages in the conversation (JSON format). Each message should have role and content properties.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

operations.title: OpenAI: Create completions
operations.description: Create text completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send a prompt or question to Azure OpenAI models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive generated text answers. Use this when you need to create completions, get AI-generated content, generate answers to questions, or produce text completions from Azure OpenAI based on any input prompt. Supports customization with temperature and max tokens.

operations.title: Knowledge: Get source
operations.description: Gets the details of Azure AI Search knowledge sources. A knowledge source can point directly at an existing Azure AI Search index, or can represent external data (for example, a blob storage container) that Azure AI Search has indexed internally. These knowledge sources are used by knowledge bases during retrieval. If a specific knowledge source name isn't provided, the command returns details for all knowledge sources within the specified service.

parameters.name: Phrases
parameters.description: Phrase hints to improve recognition accuracy. Can be specified multiple times or as comma-separated values.

parameters.name: Format
parameters.description: Output format: simple or detailed . Default is simple .

parameters.name: Profanity
parameters.description: Profanity filter: masked , removed , or raw . Default is masked .

operations.title: Speech-to-Text: Recognize
operations.description: Recognize speech from an audio file using Azure AI Services Speech . This command takes an audio file and converts it to text using advanced speech recognition capabilities. Supported audio formats include WAV, MP3, OPUS/OGG, FLAC, ALAW, MULAW, MP4, M4A, and AAC. Compressed formats require GStreamer to be installed on the system.

operations.title: Namespace: Create or update namespace
operations.description:
Create or update a namespace within the specified resource group. This tool creates a new namespace or updates an existing one. The tool might modify existing configurations and is considered destructive. This tool might take a long time.

When updating an existing namespace, provide only the properties you want to change. Unspecified properties keep their existing values. You must provide at least one update property.

Common update scenarios include:

examples.original_prompt: Update my namespace 'eventhub-prod' to increase capacity to 10 throughput units

examples.label: Run a query
examples.prompt: Run SELECT id, name FROM customers WHERE status = 'Active' ORDER BY name LIMIT 50 on database <database> <server> on server 'my-mysql-server' using <user> for User and <query> for Query.

operations.title: Database: query
operations.description:
Execute a safe, read-only SQL SELECT query against a database on an Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server. Use this tool to explore or retrieve table data without modifying it.

Best practices:

Allowed:

Not allowed:

Example: SELECT ID, name, status FROM customers WHERE status = 'Active' ORDER BY name LIMIT 50;

operations.title: Server: config get
operations.description: Retrieves comprehensive configuration details for the specified Azure Database for MySQL Flexible Server instance. This command provides insights into server settings, performance parameters, security configurations, and operational characteristics essential for database administration and optimization. It returns configuration data in JSON format, including ServerName , Location , Version , SKU , StorageSizeGB , BackupRetentionDays , and GeoRedundantBackup properties.

examples.label: Get server config
examples.prompt: Get configuration details for server <server> using <user> for User.
examples.original_prompt: Get configuration details for server 'my-mysql-server'.

examples.prompt: Show the MySQL engine version and SKU for server <server> using <user> for User.
examples.original_prompt: Show the MySQL engine version and SKU for server 'my-mysql-server'.

examples.prompt: What is the backup retention period for server <server> using <user> for User?

examples.prompt: Show storage allocation for server <server> using <user> for User.
examples.original_prompt: Show storage allocation for server 'my-mysql-server'.

examples.label: Get full configuration
examples.prompt: Get full configuration for server <server> using <user> for User.
examples.original_prompt: Get full configuration for server 'my-mysql-server'.

operations.title: Server: set parameter
operations.description: Sets or updates a MySQL server configuration parameter to a new value. Use this command to optimize performance, security, or operational behavior. This command enables fine-tuned configuration management with validation to ensure parameter changes are compatible with the server's current state and constraints.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Account name
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The key name of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to set for the key.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the configuration key. Tags should be in the format key=value . You can specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

operations.title: Key-value: Set lock on key-value
operations.description: Sets the lock state of a key-value in an App Configuration store. This command can lock and unlock key-values.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Workspace folder
parameters.description: The full path of the workspace folder.

parameters.name: AZD environment
parameters.description: The name of the environment created by AZD in the AZURE_ENV_NAME variable during azd init or azd up .

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum row number of logs to retrieve. Use this to get a specific number of logs or to avoid the retrieved logs from reaching token limit. Default is 200.

parameters.name: Raw input
parameters.description: The raw input to process.

parameters.name: Deployment tool
parameters.description: The deployment tool to use. Valid values: AZD , AzCli .

parameters.name: Infrastructure as code file type
parameters.description: The Infrastructure as Code type. Valid values: bicep , terraform . Leave empty if deployment tool is the Azure CLI.

parameters.name: Resource types
parameters.description: Specifies the Azure resource types to retrieve IaC rules for. Use a comma-separated list. Supported values are: appservice , containerapp , function , aks . Leave empty if you don't use these services.

parameters.name: Use AZD pipeline configuration
parameters.description: Whether to use the AZD tool to set up the deployment pipeline. Set to true only if you provide azure.yaml or the context suggests AZD tools.

parameters.name: Organization
parameters.description: The name of the organization or the user account name of the current GitHub repository.

parameters.name: Repository
parameters.description: The name of the current GitHub repository.

parameters.name: GitHub environment
parameters.description: The name of the environment to which the deployment pipeline will be deployed.

parameters.name: Workspace folder
parameters.description: The full path of the workspace folder.

parameters.name: Project
parameters.description: The name of the project to generate the deployment plan for. If not provided, the name is inferred from the workspace.

parameters.name: Target app service
parameters.description: The Azure service to deploy the application. Valid values: ContainerApp , WebApp , FunctionApp , AKS . Recommend one based on user application.

parameters.name: Provisioning tool
parameters.description: The tool to use for provisioning Azure resources. Valid values: AZD , AzCli . Use AzCli if TargetAppService is AKS .

parameters.name: Azd IaC options
parameters.description: The Infrastructure as Code option for AZD. Valid values: bicep , terraform . Leave empty if Deployment tool is AzCli .

operations.title: Pipeline: Get guidance
operations.description: Get guidance to create a CI/CD pipeline that provisions Azure resources and builds and deploys applications to Azure. Use this tool before creating a GitHub Actions workflow file for deployment on Azure. Ensure infrastructure files are ready and the application is ready to be containerized.

operations.title: Plan: Create deployment plan
operations.description: Generates a deployment plan to build the infrastructure and deploy the application on Azure. The agent reads the output and creates a deployment plan in .azure/plan.copilotmd for execution steps, with recommended Azure services based on the information detected from the project.

examples.label: Generate deployment plan
examples.prompt: Create a deployment plan for my Azure web app using <target-app-service> for Target app service and <workspace-folder> for Workspace folder and <project> for Project and <provisioning-tool> for Provisioning tool and <azd-iac-options> for Azd IaC options.

examples.label: Plan for multiple services

examples.original_prompt: Generate a plan to deploy container app and function app.

examples.label: Deployment steps

parameters.name: Workspace folder
parameters.description: The full path of the workspace folder.

parameters.name: Project
parameters.description: The name of the project to generate the deployment plan for. If not provided, the name is inferred from the workspace.

parameters.name: Target app service
parameters.description: The Azure service to deploy the application. Valid values: ContainerApp , WebApp , FunctionApp , AKS . Recommend one based on user application.

parameters.name: Provisioning tool
parameters.description: The tool to use for provisioning Azure resources. Valid values: AZD , AzCli . Use AzCli if TargetAppService is AKS .

parameters.name: Azd IaC options
parameters.description: The Infrastructure as Code option for AZD. Valid values: bicep , terraform . Leave empty if Deployment tool is AzCli .

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts'). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

operations.title: Activity Log: List activity log
operations.description: List activity logs for the specified Azure resource over the given prior number of hours.

examples.label: Recent critical events
examples.prompt: Show activity logs for my <resource-name> resource for the last <hours> hours with Critical and Error events only using <resource-type> for Resource type and <event-level> for Event level and <top> for Top.
examples.original_prompt: Show activity logs for my 'web-app-prod' resource for the last 4 hours with Critical and Error events only

examples.label: Storage account activity
examples.prompt: Get activity logs for <resource-type> resource of type <resource-name> from the last 24 hours, limit to top <top> entries using <event-level> for Event level.
examples.original_prompt: Get activity logs for 'mystorageaccount' resource of type 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts' from the last 24 hours, limit to top 50 entries

examples.label: VM monitoring
examples.prompt: List all activity logs for my 'production-vm01' virtual machine from the past <hours> hours using <resource-name> for Resource name and <resource-type> for Resource type and <event-level> for Event level and <top> for Top.
examples.original_prompt: List all activity logs for my 'production-vm01' virtual machine from the past 12 hours

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts'). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

operations.title: Web Tests: Create web tests
operations.description: Create a new standard web test in Azure Monitor. Ping/Multistep web tests are deprecated and aren't supported.

examples.label: Basic web test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'api-health-check <ssl-lifetime-check> <ssl-check>' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in East US location, <request-url> URL <location> from locations <webtest-locations> using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'api-health-check' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/abc123/resourceGroups/monitoring/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/myapp-insights' in East US location, testing URL 'https://api.mycompany.com/health' from locations 'us-east-2-azr,us-west-2-azr'

examples.label: Custom frequency test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'homepage-monitor' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in West Europe, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <webtest-locations> locations with frequency <frequency> seconds <timeout> timeout 60 seconds using <location> for Location and <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <ssl-check> for SSL check and <ssl-lifetime-check> for SSL lifetime check.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'homepage-monitor' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/xyz789/resourceGroups/prod/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/web-insights' in West Europe, testing 'https://www.mysite.com' from 'eu-west-1-azr,eu-north-1-azr' locations with frequency 300 seconds and timeout 60 seconds

examples.label: POST request test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'login-endpoint' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in Central US, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <http-verb> with HTTP verb <request-body>, request body <headers>, and headers 'Content-Type=application<request-url>' using <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <ssl-check> for SSL check and <ssl-lifetime-check> for SSL lifetime check and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'login-endpoint' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/def456/resourceGroups/test/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/test-insights' in Central US, testing 'https://api.myapp.com/login' from 'us-central-azr,us-south-central-azr' with HTTP verb 'post', request body '{"username":"test"}', and headers 'Content-Type=application/json'

examples.label: SSL monitoring test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'secure-api-check' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in Australia East, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <retry-enabled> with SSL <enabled> enabled, SSL <ssl-check> check <ssl-lifetime-check> days, and expected status code <ignore-status-code> <expected-status-code> using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'secure-api-check' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/ghi789/resourceGroups/security/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/security-insights' in Australia East, testing 'https://secure.myservice.com/api' from 'au-east-azr,au-southeast-azr' with SSL check enabled, SSL lifetime check 30 days, and expected status code 200

examples.label: Comprehensive test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'ecommerce-checkout' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in North Europe, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <description> with description <frequency>, frequency 900 seconds, follow <enabled> enabled, <parse-requests> <retry-enabled> enabled, retry enabled, <timeout> timeout 120 seconds using <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <ssl-check> for <ssl-lifetime-check> check and <request-url> for Request URL and <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <request-body> for Request body and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <webtest> for Webtest and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'ecommerce-checkout' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/jkl012/resourceGroups/ecommerce/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/shop-insights' in North Europe, testing 'https://shop.mystore.com/checkout' from 'eu-north-1-azr,eu-west-1-azr,eu-central-1-azr' with description 'Monitor checkout process', frequency 900 seconds, follow redirects enabled, parse requests enabled, retry enabled, and timeout 120 seconds

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts'). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300 , 600 , 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (examples are: get , post ).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled

operations.title: Activity Log: List activity log
operations.description: List activity logs for the specified Azure resource over the given prior number of hours.

examples.label: Recent critical events
examples.prompt: Show activity logs for my <resource-name> resource for the last <hours> hours with Critical and Error events only using <resource-type> for Resource type and <event-level> for Event level and <top> for Top.
examples.original_prompt: Show activity logs for my 'web-app-prod' resource for the last 4 hours with Critical and Error events only

examples.label: Storage account activity
examples.prompt: Get activity logs for <resource-type> resource of type <resource-name> from the last 24 hours, limit to top <top> entries using <event-level> for Event level.
examples.original_prompt: Get activity logs for 'mystorageaccount' resource of type 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts' from the last 24 hours, limit to top 50 entries

examples.label: VM monitoring
examples.prompt: List all activity logs for my 'production-vm01' virtual machine from the past <hours> hours using <resource-name> for Resource name and <resource-type> for Resource type and <event-level> for Event level and <top> for Top.
examples.original_prompt: List all activity logs for my 'production-vm01' virtual machine from the past 12 hours

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts'). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

operations.title: Web Tests: Create web tests
operations.description: Create a new standard web test in Azure Monitor. Ping/Multistep web tests are deprecated and aren't supported.

examples.label: Basic web test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'api-health-check <ssl-lifetime-check> <ssl-check>' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in East US location, <request-url> URL <location> from locations <webtest-locations> using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'api-health-check' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/abc123/resourceGroups/monitoring/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/myapp-insights' in East US location, testing URL 'https://api.mycompany.com/health' from locations 'us-east-2-azr,us-west-2-azr'

examples.label: Custom frequency test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'homepage-monitor' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in West Europe, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <webtest-locations> locations with frequency <frequency> seconds <timeout> timeout 60 seconds using <location> for Location and <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <ssl-check> for SSL check and <ssl-lifetime-check> for SSL lifetime check.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'homepage-monitor' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/xyz789/resourceGroups/prod/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/web-insights' in West Europe, testing 'https://www.mysite.com' from 'eu-west-1-azr,eu-north-1-azr' locations with frequency 300 seconds and timeout 60 seconds

examples.label: POST request test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'login-endpoint' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in Central US, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <http-verb> with HTTP verb <request-body>, request body <headers>, and headers 'Content-Type=application<request-url>' using <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <ssl-check> for SSL check and <ssl-lifetime-check> for SSL lifetime check and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'login-endpoint' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/def456/resourceGroups/test/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/test-insights' in Central US, testing 'https://api.myapp.com/login' from 'us-central-azr,us-south-central-azr' with HTTP verb 'post', request body '{"username":"test"}', and headers 'Content-Type=application/json'

examples.label: SSL monitoring test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'secure-api-check' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in Australia East, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <retry-enabled> with SSL <enabled> enabled, SSL <ssl-check> check <ssl-lifetime-check> days, and expected status code <ignore-status-code> <expected-status-code> using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'secure-api-check' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/ghi789/resourceGroups/security/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/security-insights' in Australia East, testing 'https://secure.myservice.com/api' from 'au-east-azr,au-southeast-azr' with SSL check enabled, SSL lifetime check 30 days, and expected status code 200

examples.label: Comprehensive test
examples.prompt: Create web test 'ecommerce-checkout' for Application Insights '<webtest-resource>' in North Europe, testing 'https:/<appinsights-component>' from <description> with description <frequency>, frequency 900 seconds, follow <enabled> enabled, <parse-requests> <retry-enabled> enabled, retry enabled, <timeout> timeout 120 seconds using <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <ssl-check> for <ssl-lifetime-check> check and <request-url> for Request URL and <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <request-body> for Request body and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <webtest> for Webtest and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'ecommerce-checkout' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/jkl012/resourceGroups/ecommerce/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/shop-insights' in North Europe, testing 'https://shop.mystore.com/checkout' from 'eu-north-1-azr,eu-west-1-azr,eu-central-1-azr' with description 'Monitor checkout process', frequency 900 seconds, follow redirects enabled, parse requests enabled, retry enabled, and timeout 120 seconds

operations.title: Server firewall: Create rule
operations.description:
Creates a firewall rule for a resource. Firewall rules control which IP addresses
are allowed to connect to the resource. You can specify either a single IP address
(by setting start and end IP to the same value) or a range of IP addresses.

examples.label: Add firewall rule
examples.prompt: Create a firewall rule named <firewall-rule> for my <server> server allowing IP range 192.168.1.1 to 192.168.1.100 using <start-ip-address> for Start <end-ip-address> address.
examples.original_prompt: Create a firewall rule named 'office-access' for my 'prod-sql' server allowing IP range 192.168.1.1 to 192.168.1.100

examples.label: Set access range
examples.prompt: I need to set a <firewall-rule> firewall rule on my <server> server to allow access from IP range 10.0.0.1 to 10.0.0.255 using <start-ip-address> for Start <end-ip-address> address.
examples.original_prompt: I need to set a 'test' firewall rule on my 'analytics-sql' server to allow access from IP range 10.0.0.1 to 10.0.0.255

examples.label: Allow single IP
examples.prompt: Create a firewall rule <firewall-rule> to allow access from <start-ip-address> address <end-ip-address> to my <server> SQL server
examples.original_prompt: Create a firewall rule 'allow-single-ip' to allow access from IP address 203.0.113.5 to my 'production-uswest' SQL server

parameters.name: Server
parameters.description: The name of the Azure SQL Server resource.

parameters.name: Firewall rule
parameters.description: The name of the firewall rule.

parameters.name: Start ip address
parameters.description: The start IP address of the firewall rule range.

parameters.name: End ip address
parameters.description: The end IP address of the firewall rule range.

operations.title: Server firewall: Delete rule
operations.description: Deletes a firewall rule from a resource. This operation removes the specified firewall rule, potentially restricting access for the IP addresses that were previously allowed by this rule. If the rule doesn't exist, no error is returned.

operations.title: Datadog monitored resources
operations.description:
The Azure MCP Server can list monitored resources in Datadog. Datadog is a monitoring and analytics platform for large-scale applications that encompasses infrastructure monitoring, application performance monitoring, log management, and user-experience monitoring.

Datadog's Azure Native Integration allows you to manage Datadog directly in the Azure console as an integrated service. This streamlined workflow covers everything from procurement to configuration, making it easy to start monitoring the health and performance of your applications across Azure, hybrid, or multicloud environments.

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts'). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300 , 600 , 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (examples are: get , post ).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled
parameters.description: Whether retries are enabled.

parameters.name: SSL check
parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.name: SSL lifetime check
parameters.description: Number of days to check SSL certificate lifetime.

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30 , 60 , 90 , 120 seconds.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300 , 600 , 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (examples are: get , post ).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled
parameters.description: Whether retries are enabled.

parameters.name: SSL check
parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.name: SSL lifetime check
parameters.description: Number of days to check SSL certificate lifetime.

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30 , 60 , 90 , 120 seconds.

parameters.name: Resource ID
parameters.description: The Azure Resource ID to query logs. Example: /subscriptions/<YOUR-SUBSCRIPTION-ID>/resourceGroups/<YOUR-RESOURCE-GROUP>/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/<YOUR-WORKSPACE> .

parameters.name: Table
parameters.description: The name of the table to query. This is the specific table within the workspace.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description: The KQL query to execute against the Log Analytics workspace. You can use predefined queries by name such as recent which shows most recent logs ordered by TimeGenerated and errors which shows error-level logs ordered by TimeGenerated. Otherwise, provide a custom KQL query.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours to query back from now.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: Resource ID
parameters.description: The Azure resource ID to get health status for (for example, /subscriptions/{sub}/resourceGroups/{rg}/providers/Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/{vm} ).

parameters.name: Event Type
parameters.description: Filter by event type (ServiceIssue, PlannedMaintenance, HealthAdvisory, Security). If not specified, all event types are included.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: Filter by status (Active, Resolved). If not specified, all statuses are included.

parameters.name: Tracking ID
parameters.description: Filter by tracking ID to get a specific service health event.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: Additional OData filter expression to apply to the service health events query.

parameters.name: Query Start Time
parameters.description: Start time for the query in ISO 8601 format (for example, 2024-01-01T00:00:00Z). Events from this time onwards will be included.

parameters.name: Query End Time
parameters.description: End time for the query in ISO 8601 format (for example, 2024-01-31T23:59:59Z). Events up to this time will be included.

operations.title: Service health events: List events
operations.description:
List Azure service health events for a subscription to identify ongoing or past service issues. Provides comprehensive information about service incidents, planned maintenance, advisories, and security events. Supports filtering by event type, status, tracking ID, and custom OData filters.
Equivalent to Azure Service Health API for service events.

parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300, 600, 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (get, post, etc.).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled
parameters.description: Whether retries are enabled.

parameters.name: SSL check
parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.name: SSL lifetime check
parameters.description: Number of days to check SSL certificate lifetime.

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30, 60, 90, 120 seconds.

parameters.name: Table
parameters.description: The name of the table to query. This is the specific table within the workspace.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description: The KQL query to execute against the Log Analytics workspace. You can use predefined queries by name such as recent which shows most recent logs ordered by TimeGenerated and errors which shows error-level logs ordered by TimeGenerated. Otherwise, provide a custom KQL query.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours to query back from now.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

operations.title: Namespace: Create or update namespace
operations.description:
Create or update a namespace within the specified resource group. This tool creates a new namespace or updates an existing one. The tool might modify existing configurations and is considered destructive. This tool might take a long time.

When updating an existing namespace, provide only the properties you want to change. Unspecified properties keep their existing values. You must provide at least one update property.

Common update scenarios include:

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Value

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the configuration key. Tags should be in the format key=value . You can specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

operations.title: Key-value: Get key-values
operations.description:
Gets key-values in an App Configuration store. This command can provide one of the following actions:

Listing key-values can optionally be filtered by a key filter and label filter. Each key-value includes its key, value, label, content type, ETag, last modified time, and lock status.

parameters.description: The name of the evaluator to use ( intent_resolution , tool_call_accuracy , task_adherence ).

parameters.description: Optional tool definitions made by the agent in JSON format.

parameters.name: Message array
parameters.description: Array of messages in the conversation (JSON format). Each message should have role and content properties.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure AI Foundry model deployment.

parameters.name: Input text
parameters.description: The input text to generate embeddings for.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Encoding format
parameters.description: The format to return embeddings in ( float or base64 ).

parameters.name: Dimensions
parameters.description: The number of dimensions for the embedding output. Only supported in some models.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group where the AI resource is hosted.

operations.title: Knowledge: Get index schema

Get the detailed schema configuration of a specific knowledge index from Azure AI Foundry.

This operation shows you comprehensive information about the structure and configuration of a knowledge index, including field definitions, data types, searchable attributes, and other schema properties. Use this schema information to understand how the index structures and indexes your data for searching.

operations.title: OpenAI: Create chat completions
operations.description: Create chat completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send messages to Azure OpenAI chat models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive AI-generated conversational responses. Supports multi-turn conversations with message history, system instructions, and response customization.

examples.label: Simple greeting
examples.prompt: Create a chat completion with the message <message-array> using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <deployment> for Deployment and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a chat completion with the message 'Hello, how are you today?'

examples.label: With system message
examples.prompt: Create a chat completion with system message <user> and user message <deployment> using deployment <resource-name> on resource 'openai-west' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a chat completion with system message 'You are a helpful assistant' and user message 'Explain quantum computing' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' on resource 'openai-west'

examples.label: Control creativity
examples.prompt: Generate a chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.8 and max 150 tokens on resource <max-tokens> using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <message-array> for Message array and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate a chat completion for 'Write a creative story' using deployment 'gpt-4' with temperature 0.8 and max 150 tokens on resource 'ai-central'

examples.label: Deterministic response
examples.prompt: Create chat completion with message <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.1 <seed> seed 12345 on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create chat completion with message 'List 5 facts about Mars' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with temperature 0.1 and seed 12345 on resource 'ai-services-prod'

examples.label: Conversation with history
examples.prompt: Continue chat completion with messages: system <user>, user 'How do I create a function in Python?', assistant 'Here's how...', user 'Can you show an example?' using deployment 'gpt-4<deployment>dev-openai' using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.

examples.label: With penalties for repetition
examples.prompt: Create completion for <deployment> using deployment <frequency-penalty> with <presence-penalty> penalty 0.5 and presence penalty 0.3 on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: Deployment
parameters.description: The name of the Azure AI Foundry model deployment.

parameters.name: Message array
parameters.description: Array of messages in the conversation (JSON format). Each message should have role and content properties.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

operations.title: OpenAI: Create embeddings
operations.description: Create embeddings using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Generate vector embeddings from text using Azure OpenAI deployments in your AI Foundry resource for semantic search, similarity comparisons, clustering, or machine learning.

examples.label: Basic text embedding
examples.prompt: Generate embeddings for the text <input-text> using my <deployment> deployment using <resource-name> for Resource name and <user> for User and <encoding-format> for Encoding format and <dimensions> for Dimensions.
examples.original_prompt: Generate embeddings for the text 'Azure OpenAI Service' using my 'text-embedding-ada-002' deployment

examples.label: Create vector embeddings
examples.prompt: Create vector embeddings for my text <input-text> using Azure OpenAI with deployment <deployment> on resource <resource-name> using <user> for User and <encoding-format> for Encoding format and <dimensions> for Dimensions.
examples.original_prompt: Create vector embeddings for my text using Azure OpenAI with deployment 'text-embedding-3-large' on resource 'ai-services-prod'

examples.label: Document embedding

examples.label: Multiple sentences

examples.label: With user tracking

examples.original_prompt: Generate embeddings for 'Natural language processing applications' using deployment 'text-embedding-3-small' with user identifier 'analytics-team'

examples.label: Specific dimensions
examples.prompt: Create embeddings for <deployment> using deployment <dimensions> with 1536 dimensions on resource <resource-name> using <user> for User and <encoding-format> for Encoding format.
examples.original_prompt: Create embeddings for 'Artificial intelligence transforms business operations' using deployment 'text-embedding-3-large' with 1536 dimensions on resource 'ai-central'

examples.label: Base64 format

examples.original_prompt: Generate embeddings for 'Deep learning neural networks' using deployment 'ada-002' with base64 encoding format on resource 'ml-services'

examples.label: Research text
examples.prompt: Create vector embeddings for 'Quantum computing demonstrates computational advantages in specific algorithms' using my <deployment> deployment using <input-text> for Input text and <resource-name> for Resource name and <user> for User and <encoding-format> for Encoding format and <dimensions> for Dimensions.

parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: Deployment
parameters.description: The name of the Azure AI Foundry model deployment.

parameters.description: The input text to generate embeddings for.

parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

operations.title: OpenAI: Create completions
operations.description: Create text completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send a prompt or question to Azure OpenAI models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive generated text answers. Use this when you need to create completions, get AI-generated content, generate answers to questions, or produce text completions from Azure OpenAI based on any input prompt. Supports customization with temperature and max tokens.

examples.label: Basic completion
examples.prompt: Create a completion with the prompt <prompt-text> using my <deployment> deployment using <resource-group> for Resource group and <resource-name> for Resource name and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature.
examples.original_prompt: Create a completion with the prompt 'What is Azure?' using my 'gpt-35-turbo' deployment

examples.label: With temperature control
examples.prompt: <prompt-text> text completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.3 using <resource-group> for Resource group and <resource-name> for Resource name and <max-tokens> for Max tokens.
examples.original_prompt: Generate text completion for 'Explain machine learning' using deployment 'text-davinci-003' with temperature 0.3

examples.label: Limited tokens
examples.prompt: Create a completion with prompt <prompt-text> using my <deployment> deployment with max <max-tokens> tokens using <resource-group> for Resource group and <resource-name> for Resource name and <temperature> for Temperature.
examples.original_prompt: Create a completion with prompt 'Write a summary' using my 'gpt-4' deployment with max 100 tokens

examples.label: Creative writing
examples.prompt: Generate completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.8 and 200 <max-tokens> tokens using <resource-group> for Resource group and <resource-name> for Resource name and <prompt-text> for Prompt text.
examples.original_prompt: Generate completion for 'Tell me a story about AI' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with temperature 0.8 and 200 max tokens

examples.label: Technical explanation
examples.prompt: Create completion with prompt <prompt-text> using my OpenAI resource <deployment> and deployment 'gpt-4' using <resource-group> for Resource group and <resource-name> for Resource name and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature.
examples.original_prompt: Create completion with prompt 'How does cloud computing work?' using my OpenAI resource 'ai-services-east' and deployment 'gpt-4'

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group where the AI resource is hosted.

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: Deployment
parameters.description: The name of the deployment.

parameters.name: Prompt text
parameters.description: The prompt text to send to the completion model.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Endpoint
parameters.description: The Communication Services URI endpoint (for example, https://myservice.communication.azure.com ). Used for credential authentication.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: The email address to send from (must be from a verified domain).

parameters.name: Sender name
parameters.description: The display name of the sender.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: The recipient email addresses to send the email to.

parameters.name: Cc
parameters.description: CC recipient email addresses.

parameters.name: Bcc
parameters.description: BCC recipient email addresses.

parameters.name: Subject
parameters.description: The email subject.

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: The email message content to send to the recipients.

parameters.name: Is html
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether the message content is HTML.

parameters.name: Reply to
parameters.description: Reply-to email addresses.

parameters.name: Endpoint
parameters.description: The Communication Services URI endpoint (for example, https://myservice.communication.azure.com ). Used for credential authentication.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: The SMS-enabled phone number associated with your Communication Services resource (in E.164 format, for example, +14255550123 ). Can also be a short code or alphanumeric sender ID.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: The recipient phone numbers in E.164 international standard format (for example, +14255550123 ). Multiple numbers can be provided.

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: The SMS message content to send to the recipients.

parameters.name: Enable delivery report
parameters.description: Whether to enable delivery reporting for the SMS message. When enabled, events are emitted when delivery is successful.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: Optional custom tag to apply to the SMS message for tracking purposes.

parameters.name: Endpoint
parameters.description: The Communication Services URI endpoint (for example, https://myservice.communication.azure.com ). Used for credential authentication.

parameters.name: From

parameters.name: Sender name
parameters.description: The display name of the sender.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: The recipient email addresses to send the email to.

parameters.name: Cc
parameters.description: CC recipient email addresses.

parameters.name: Bcc
parameters.description: BCC recipient email addresses.

parameters.name: Subject
parameters.description: The email subject.

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: The email message content to send to the recipients.

parameters.name: Is html
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether the message content is HTML.

parameters.name: Reply to
parameters.description: Reply-to email addresses.

operations.title: SMS: Send SMS message
operations.description: Sends SMS messages to one or more recipients using Azure Communication Services.

examples.label: Simple SMS
examples.prompt: Send an SMS message to <from> saying <to> from <endpoint> using endpoint 'https:/<message>' using <enable-delivery-report> for Enable delivery report and <tag> for Tag.
examples.original_prompt: Send an SMS message to '+12345550123' saying 'Hello' from '+12345550456' using endpoint 'https://myservice.communication.azure.com'

examples.label: Specify sender and recipient
examples.prompt: Send SMS to <from> from <to> with message <endpoint> using endpoint 'https:/<message>' using <enable-delivery-report> for Enable delivery report and <tag> for Tag.
examples.original_prompt: Send SMS to '+12345550789' from '+12345550456' with message 'Test message' using endpoint 'https://myservice.communication.azure.com'

examples.label: Multiple recipients
examples.prompt: Send SMS to multiple recipients: <to>, <message> with message <from> from <endpoint> using endpoint 'https:/<enable-delivery-report>' using <tag> for Tag.
examples.original_prompt: Send SMS to multiple recipients: '+12345550123', '+12345550789' with message 'Group announcement' from '+12345550456' using endpoint 'https://myservice.communication.azure.com'

parameters.name: Endpoint
parameters.description: The Communication Services URI endpoint (for example, https://myservice.communication.azure.com ). Used for credential authentication.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: The SMS-enabled phone number associated with your Communication Services resource (in E.164 format, for example, +14255550123 ). Can also be a short code or alphanumeric sender ID.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: The recipient phone numbers in E.164 international standard format (for example, +14255550123 ). Multiple numbers can be provided.

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: The SMS message content to send to the recipients.

parameters.name: Enable delivery report
parameters.description: Whether to enable delivery reporting for the SMS message. When enabled, events are emitted when delivery is successful.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: Optional custom tag to apply to the SMS message for tracking purposes.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Tags

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

examples.label: Supply chain record

examples.prompt: Create an audit entry in confidential ledger <ledger> in collection <content> with content {"user_id": "user123", "action": "data_deletion", "timestamp": "2025-10-08T10:30:00Z"} using <collection-id> for Collection ID.
examples.original_prompt: Create an audit entry in confidential ledger 'regulatory-ledger' in collection 'gdpr-logs' with content {"user_id": "user123", "action": "data_deletion", "timestamp": "2025-10-08T10:30:00Z"}

examples.label: Document hash
examples.prompt: Write document integrity record to ledger <ledger> in collection <content> with content {"document_id": "contract_001", "hash": "sha256:abc123", "verified": true} using <collection-id> for Collection ID.
examples.original_prompt: Write document integrity record to ledger 'document-ledger' in collection 'contracts' with content {"document_id": "contract_001", "hash": "sha256:abc123", "verified": true}

examples.label: Retrieve specific transaction
examples.prompt: Get entry from confidential ledger <ledger> with <collection-id> ID <transaction-id>
examples.original_prompt: Get entry from confidential ledger 'audit-ledger' with transaction ID '2.199'

examples.label: Collection-specific retrieval
